text: Welcome to today's lesson! We'll learn how to order at a coffee shop. When you're ready, click the button below to start!
When you enter a coffee shop, you walk up to the counter. Here are polite ways to start your order. Which one would you like to practice?
I'd like a coffee, please
Can I have a latte?
Could I get a cappuccino?
I'll have an espresso
Great choice! Now try saying your chosen phrase to order a drink!
Well done! You ordered perfectly. Let's move on to choosing the size!
Good try! Remember to use the ordering phrase you selected. Try again!
Let's focus on ordering your drink. Try using the phrase shown in the reference card above.
The barista asks: 'What size would you like?' Here's how to specify the size of your drink:
A small one, please
Medium, please
I'd like a large
The biggest size you have
Perfect! Now tell the barista what size you want. Try saying your phrase!
Great job! You specified the size perfectly. Now let's choose hot or iced!
Nice effort! Try including the size in your order. Try again!
Let's practice choosing the size. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The barista asks: 'Would you like that hot or iced?' Here's how to answer:
Hot, please
Iced, please
Can I have it iced?
I'd like it hot
Excellent! Now tell the barista if you want it hot or iced. Try your phrase!
Excellent! You chose the temperature perfectly. Now let's customize your drink!
Good attempt! Try mentioning hot or iced in your answer. Try again!
Let's practice the temperature choice. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Want to customize? Here's how to add extras or make changes:
with extra milk
with no sugar
with oat milk instead
with an extra shot of espresso
Great! Now add your customization to the order. Try saying your phrase!
Perfect customization! You're getting really good at this. Let's decide: for here or to go?
Almost there! Try adding a customization like milk or sugar. Try again!
Let's practice customizing your order. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The barista asks: 'For here or to go?' Here's how to answer:
For here, please
To go, please
I'll have it here
Can I get that to go?
Perfect! Now tell the barista where you'll have your drink. Try your phrase!
Awesome! You answered perfectly. Now the barista wants to know if you'd like anything else!
Good try! Remember to say whether it's for here or to go. Try again!
Let's practice saying where you'll have your drink. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The barista asks: 'Would you like anything else with that?' Here are your options:
Yes, I'd also like something to eat
What pastries do you have?
No, that's all, thank you
Just the coffee, thanks
Nice! If you want food, let's see what they have. If not, we'll go straight to paying.
Great! Let's see what else they have for you!
Good try! Say whether you'd like something else or not. Try again!
Let's answer the barista's question. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Here's the food menu! Which item would you like to order?
I'll have a croissant
Can I get a blueberry muffin?
I'd like a slice of chocolate cake
A ham and cheese sandwich, please
Delicious choice! Now order your food item. Try saying your phrase!
Yummy! Great food order! Now the barista will ask if you want it warmed up.
Good try! Order a food item using a complete sentence. Try again!
Let's order some food. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The barista asks: 'Would you like that warmed up?' Here's how to respond:
Yes, please warm it up
Yes, just a little bit
No, it's fine like this
No thanks, I prefer it cold
Great! Now tell the barista if you want your food warmed up or not.
Perfect! Now it's time to pay for your order!
Good try! Say yes or no about warming up your food. Try again!
Let's answer about warming your food. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time to pay! Here are useful phrases for finishing your order:
How much is that?
Can I pay by card?
Do you accept Apple Pay?
Here you go, keep the change
Almost done! Now ask about paying. Try saying your phrase!
Great! Payment done! Now let's say goodbye to the barista!
Good try! Ask about the price or how to pay. Try again!
Let's practice paying. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The barista says: 'Here's your order! Have a great day!' Now it's time to say goodbye politely:
Thank you! Have a nice day!
Thanks! See you next time!
Thanks a lot! Bye!
Thank you so much! Take care!
Wonderful! Now say goodbye to the barista. Try saying your phrase!
Wonderful goodbye! You completed the entire coffee shop experience!
Good try! Say a friendly goodbye like thank you or have a nice day. Try again!
Let's say goodbye politely. Use the phrase from the reference card above.

Congratulations! You've completed the coffee shop lesson! You now know how to: start an order, choose size and temperature, customize your drink, order food, and pay. You're ready to order like a pro at any coffee shop!
Welcome to today's lesson! We'll learn how to order at a restaurant. When you're ready, click the button below to start!
You arrive at the restaurant. The host asks: 'How many people?' Here's how to request a table:
A table for two, please
We have a reservation under Smith
Do you have any tables available?
Can we sit by the window?
Great! Now imagine you're at the entrance. Ask for a table using that phrase.
Perfect! The host is leading you to your table. Now let's order some drinks!
Good try! Remember to ask for a table politely. Try again!
Let's ask for a table. Try using the phrase from the reference card above.
The waiter asks: 'What would you like to drink?' Here's how to order drinks:
I'll have a glass of water, please
Can I see the wine list?
I'd like a soda
Just water for now, thanks
Perfect! Now order your drink using that phrase.
Great! Your drink is on its way. Now let's look at the menu!
Good try! Order a drink using a complete phrase. Try again!
Let's order a drink. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You're looking at the menu. Here's how to ask questions about the food:
What do you recommend?
What's the special today?
Is this dish spicy?
Does this contain nuts?
Great! Now ask a question about the menu using that phrase.
Excellent! Good question! Now let's order your main course!
Good try! Ask a question about the menu. Try again!
Let's ask about the menu. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time to order! Here's how to order your main dish:
I'll have the grilled salmon
I'd like the chicken pasta, please
Can I get the steak, medium rare?
I'll try the vegetarian option
Excellent! Now order your main course using that phrase.
Well done! That sounds delicious! Now let's check if you have any special requests.
Good try! Order your main dish using a complete sentence. Try again!
Let's order your meal. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You have a special dietary need or preference. Here's how to make requests:
Can I have it without onions?
I'm allergic to shellfish
Could you make it less salty?
Is there a gluten-free option?
Great! Now make a special request using that phrase.
Great! The waiter noted your request. Let's enjoy the meal!
Good try! Make your special request clearly. Try again!
Let's make a special request. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
While eating, you might need something. Here's how to ask:
Could we have some more bread?
Excuse me, can I have another napkin?
This is delicious!
Could you bring some salt, please?
Perfect! Now practice asking for something during your meal.
Perfect! The waiter is bringing what you need. Time to think about dessert!
Good try! Ask for what you need during the meal. Try again!
Let's ask for something. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The waiter asks: 'Would you like dessert?' Here are your options:
Yes, can I see the dessert menu?
I'll have the chocolate cake
No dessert, just coffee, please
No thanks, just the check, please
Wonderful! Now respond about dessert using that phrase.
Great choice! Let's see what desserts they have!
Good try! Respond about dessert using the phrase. Try again!
Let's respond about dessert. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time for something sweet! Here's how to order dessert:
I'll have the cheesecake
Can we share the ice cream?
What's your most popular dessert?
I'd like the fruit salad
Delicious! Now order your dessert using that phrase.
Yummy! Great dessert choice! Now it's time to ask for the check.
Good try! Order your dessert using a complete phrase. Try again!
Let's order dessert. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time to pay! Here's how to ask for the check:
Could we have the check, please?
Can we pay separately?
Is service included?
Can I pay by card?
Almost done! Now ask for the check using that phrase.
Well done! Payment sorted! Now let's say goodbye to the staff.
Good try! Ask about paying using the phrase. Try again!
Let's ask for the check. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time to leave! Here's how to thank the staff and say goodbye:
Thank you, the food was excellent!
Everything was great, thank you!
We had a lovely time, thanks!
Great service! We'll come back!
Wonderful! Now thank the staff and say goodbye.
Wonderful goodbye! You completed the entire restaurant experience!
Good try! Thank the staff with a friendly goodbye. Try again!
Let's say goodbye. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Congratulations! You've completed the restaurant lesson! You now know how to: get a table, order drinks and food, make special requests, and pay the bill. You're ready to dine out with confidence!
Welcome to today's lesson! We'll learn how to check in and communicate at a hotel. When you're ready, click the button below to start!
You arrive at the reception desk. Here's how to greet and start the check-in:
Hi, I have a reservation
Good evening, I'd like to check in
Hello, I booked a room online
Hi, the reservation is under Johnson
Great! Now imagine you're at the front desk. Use that phrase to start your check-in.
Perfect! The receptionist found your booking. Let's confirm your room details!
Good try! Greet the receptionist and start your check-in. Try again!
Let's check in at the hotel. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The receptionist asks for details. Here's how to confirm your reservation:
It's for three nights
I booked a double room
The confirmation number is 12345
It should be under my email address
Perfect! Now confirm your booking details using that phrase.
Great! Your room type is confirmed. Let's talk about your stay duration!
Good try! Specify your room preference clearly. Try again!
Let's choose a room. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The receptionist asks about room preferences. Here's how to express yours:
Could I have a room with a view?
I'd prefer a quiet room
Is there a room on a higher floor?
I need a non-smoking room
Great! Now express your room preference using that phrase.
Excellent! Stay details confirmed. Let's check about breakfast and amenities!
Good try! Tell them about your stay. Try again!
Let's confirm your stay. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You want to know about hotel services. Here's how to ask:
Does the room have Wi-Fi?
What time is breakfast?
Is there a gym in the hotel?
Do you have room service?
Perfect! Now ask about an amenity using that phrase.
Well done! Now let's ask about any special requests you might have.
Good try! Ask about hotel services. Try again!
Let's ask about services. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The receptionist gives you the key. Here's how to ask for information:
Which floor is my room on?
Where is the elevator?
Is there parking available?
What's the Wi-Fi password?
Great! Now ask for information about your room or the hotel.
Perfect! Your request is noted. Let's head to your room!
Good try! Make your special request clearly. Try again!
Let's make a request. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You're in your room and need something. Here's how to request it:
Could I have extra towels, please?
The air conditioning isn't working
I need a wake-up call at 7 AM
Could you bring some pillows?
Perfect! Now make a request for your room using that phrase.
Great! You're settling into your room. Let's learn about hotel facilities!
Good try! Describe any room issues clearly. Try again!
Let's talk about the room. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Something is wrong in your room. Here's how to report it:
The TV isn't working
There's no hot water
The room hasn't been cleaned
I think there's a mistake with my bill
Got it! Now report a problem using that phrase.
Excellent! Now let's learn about nearby attractions!
Good try! Ask about hotel facilities. Try again!
Let's ask about facilities. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You want to stay longer. Here's how to ask about extending:
Can I extend my stay by one night?
Is the same room available tomorrow?
What's the rate for an extra night?
I'd like to stay until Sunday
Great! Now ask about extending your stay using that phrase.
Great tips! Now let's learn about room service and ordering food.
Good try! Ask about things to do nearby. Try again!
Let's ask about the area. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time to check out! Here's how to complete your stay:
I'd like to check out, please
Can I have my bill?
Can I leave my bags here?
Could you call a taxi for me?
Almost done! Now complete your check-out using that phrase.
Well done! Your order is on its way. Now let's prepare for checkout!
Good try! Order room service clearly. Try again!
Let's order room service. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time to leave! Here's how to thank the staff:
Thank you, I had a great stay!
Everything was perfect, thanks!
I'll definitely come back!
Thanks for all your help!
Wonderful! Now thank the staff and say goodbye.
Wonderful! You completed the entire hotel experience!
Good try! Check out politely using the phrase. Try again!
Let's check out. Use the phrase from the reference card above.

Congratulations! You've completed the hotel lesson! You now know how to: check in, ask about amenities, make requests, report problems, and check out. You're ready to stay at any hotel with confidence!
Welcome to today's lesson! We'll learn how to navigate the airport and communicate effectively. When you're ready, click the button below to start!
You arrive at the check-in counter. Here's how to start:
Hi, I'd like to check in for my flight
Here's my passport and ticket
I'm flying to London
My flight is at 3 PM
Great! Now imagine you're at check-in. Use that phrase to start.
Great! The agent is pulling up your booking. Let's confirm your flight details!
Good try! Start your check-in clearly. Try again!
Let's check in for your flight. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The agent asks about your luggage. Here's how to respond:
I have one bag to check
Just carry-on luggage
Is this bag too heavy?
Can I take this as hand luggage?
Perfect! Now respond about your luggage using that phrase.
Perfect! Your luggage is checked. Let's talk about your seat!
Good try! Tell them about your luggage. Try again!
Let's handle your luggage. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The agent asks about seating. Here's how to express your preference:
Window seat, please
I'd prefer an aisle seat
Do you have any exit row seats?
Can I sit near the front?
Great! Now express your seat preference using that phrase.
Excellent! Seat confirmed. Now let's go through security!
Good try! Request your seat preference. Try again!
Let's choose your seat. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
At security, the officer gives instructions. Here's how to respond:
Do I need to take off my shoes?
Should I take out my laptop?
Is this okay to bring on the plane?
Where should I put my liquids?
Perfect! Now ask a security question using that phrase.
Well done! You passed security. Let's find your gate!
Good try! Follow the security instructions. Try again!
Let's go through security. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You need to find your boarding gate. Here's how to ask:
Where is gate B12?
How do I get to Terminal 2?
Is there a shuttle to the other terminal?
How long does it take to walk there?
Great! Now ask for directions using that phrase.
Great! You found the gate. Let's check on your flight status!
Good try! Ask for directions to your gate. Try again!
Let's find the gate. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You're waiting at the gate. Here are useful phrases:
Is this the gate for the London flight?
Is the flight on time?
When will boarding start?
Has boarding started yet?
Perfect! Now ask about your flight using that phrase.
Perfect! Flight info confirmed. Let's grab something while you wait!
Good try! Ask about your flight status. Try again!
Let's check the flight status. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time to board! Here's how to communicate with the crew:
Excuse me, where is seat 24A?
Can I put my bag in the overhead bin?
Is this seat taken?
Could you help me with my luggage?
Great! Now communicate with the crew using that phrase.
Nice! Now let's learn how to handle a delay or issue.
Good try! Order something at the airport. Try again!
Let's order something. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
During the flight, you might need something. Here's how to ask:
Could I have a blanket, please?
What drinks do you have?
Is there a vegetarian meal?
Can I get some water?
Perfect! Now make a request during the flight.
Well done! You handled that well. Time to board your flight!
Good try! Explain your situation clearly. Try again!
Let's handle this situation. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
At immigration, the officer asks questions. Here's how to answer:
I'm here on vacation
I'm staying for two weeks
I'm visiting friends
Here's my return ticket
Great! Now answer the immigration officer using that phrase.
Great! You're boarding. Now let's settle into your seat!
Good try! Board the plane using the phrase. Try again!
Let's board the plane. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
At baggage claim. Here's how to ask for help if needed:
Which carousel is for flight BA123?
My luggage hasn't arrived
Where can I report lost luggage?
Is there a luggage cart?
Almost done! Now ask for help at baggage claim.
Wonderful! You completed the entire airport experience!
Good try! Communicate with the flight crew. Try again!
Let's talk to the crew. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Congratulations! You've completed the airport lesson! You now know how to: check in, go through security, find your gate, board the plane, and handle immigration. You're ready to fly with confidence!
Welcome to today's lesson! We'll learn how to shop at a supermarket. When you're ready, click the button below to start!
You're looking for something in the store. Here's how to ask for help:
Excuse me, where is the milk?
Which aisle is the bread in?
Do you have organic vegetables?
Where can I find the cleaning products?
Great! Now ask a store employee for help using that phrase.
Great! You found your way around. Let's look for specific items!
Good try! Ask for help finding things. Try again!
Let's ask for directions. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You want to know more about a product. Here's how to ask:
Is this product fresh?
What's the expiration date?
Is this on sale?
Do you have a larger size?
Perfect! Now ask about a product using that phrase.
Well done! You found the produce. Let's check the other aisles!
Good try! Ask about specific products. Try again!
Let's ask about products. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
At the deli counter, you want to order some items:
Can I have 200 grams of ham?
I'd like some sliced cheese
A little more, please
That's enough, thank you
Great! Now order something from the deli using that phrase.
Excellent! Good question. Let's compare some prices!
Good try! Ask about product details. Try again!
Let's ask about the product. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You're at the produce section. Ask about fresh items or quantities.
Are these strawberries fresh?
How much is a pound of tomatoes?
Can I get a bag for the apples?
Which vegetables are in season?
Great choice! Now try asking about the fresh produce!
Nice! You're getting great fresh produce. Let's head to the deli counter!
Good try! Ask about the produce clearly. Try again!
Let's ask about the produce. Try using the phrase from the card above.
At the bakery section. Here's how to order:
I'll take two baguettes, please
Is this bread baked today?
Can I have that croissant?
Do you have whole wheat bread?
Perfect! Now order from the bakery using that phrase.
Great find! Let's keep shopping!
Good try! Ask about prices or deals. Try again!
Let's check the prices. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You want to know the price of something. Here's how to ask:
How much is this?
Is there a discount on this?
Do you price match?
What's the price per kilo?
Great! Now ask about the price using that phrase.
Well done! Your cart is looking good. Let's head to checkout!
Good try! Ask for help with your shopping. Try again!
Let's continue shopping. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You're at the checkout. Here are useful phrases:
Do you have a loyalty card?
I don't need a bag, thanks
Can I have a bag, please?
I'd like to use my coupons
Perfect! Now communicate at the checkout using that phrase.
Perfect! Now let's pay for your groceries!
Good try! Talk to the cashier clearly. Try again!
Let's talk to the cashier. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Time to pay! Here's how to handle payment:
Can I pay by card?
Do you accept contactless?
I'll pay in cash
Can I get cash back?
Great! Now handle the payment using that phrase.
Great! Payment done. Let's wrap up your shopping trip!
Good try! Handle the payment clearly. Try again!
Let's pay for the groceries. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The cashier asks about bags. Decide how you want your groceries packed.
Paper bags, please.
I brought my own bags.
Can I get some plastic bags?
I don't need a bag, thanks.
Great choice! Now tell the cashier about your bag preference!
Perfect! Your groceries are being bagged. Time to pay!
Good effort! Tell the cashier about bags clearly. Try again!
Let's tell the cashier about bags. Try the phrase from the card.
Almost done! Here's how to finish your shopping:
Can I have a receipt?
Thank you, have a nice day!
Where is the exit?
Thanks for your help!
Wonderful! Now finish your shopping using that phrase.
Wonderful! You completed the entire supermarket experience!
Good try! Say goodbye politely. Try again!
Let's finish up. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Congratulations! You've completed the supermarket lesson! You now know how to: find items, ask about products, order at the deli, and pay at checkout. You're ready to shop with confidence!
Welcome to today's lesson! We'll learn how to handle banking transactions. When you're ready, click the button below to start!
You enter the bank and approach the counter. Here's how to greet:
Good morning, I need some help
Hi, I'd like to speak to someone
Hello, I have an appointment
Excuse me, where do I take a number?
Great! Now greet the bank staff using that phrase.
Great! The teller is ready to help. Let's tell them what you need!
Good try! Greet the bank employee. Try again!
Let's greet the teller. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The teller asks how they can help. Here's how to explain:
I'd like to open an account
I need to make a deposit
I want to withdraw some money
I need to transfer funds
Perfect! Now explain what you need using that phrase.
Well done! They understand your need. Let's provide your details!
Good try! Explain what you need clearly. Try again!
Let's explain your need. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You have questions about your account. Here's how to ask:
What's my account balance?
Can I see my recent transactions?
What's the interest rate?
Are there any fees?
Great! Now ask about your account using that phrase.
Excellent! Your information is verified. Let's proceed with the transaction!
Good try! Provide your details clearly. Try again!
Let's provide your information. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You're ready to make a transaction. Here's how to proceed:
I'd like to deposit 500 dollars
Can I withdraw 200 dollars?
I need to exchange currency
I want to pay this bill
Perfect! Now make your transaction using that phrase.
Perfect! The transaction is being processed. Let's ask about additional services!
Good try! Confirm the transaction details. Try again!
Let's confirm the transaction. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You have a problem with your card. Here's how to explain:
My card isn't working
I lost my debit card
I need a new PIN
Can I block my card?
Got it! Now explain your card issue using that phrase.
Great! Good to know about those services. Let's ask about fees!
Good try! Ask about bank services. Try again!
Let's ask about services. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You need help with the ATM. Here's how to ask:
Where is the nearest ATM?
The ATM ate my card
How do I use this machine?
Is there a withdrawal limit?
Great! Now ask about the ATM using that phrase.
Well done! All clear on the fees. Let's finalize everything!
Good try! Ask about fees and conditions. Try again!
Let's ask about fees. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
You're finishing up at the bank. Here are useful phrases:
Is there anything else I need to sign?
When will this be processed?
Can I have a receipt?
Thank you for your help!
Wonderful! Now finish your visit using that phrase.
Wonderful! You completed the entire bank experience!
Good try! Thank the teller and say goodbye. Try again!
Let's wrap up. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Banking can be confusing. Here's how to ask about terms:
What does 'APR' mean?
Can you explain the overdraft policy?
What's the difference between savings and checking?
Is there a minimum balance requirement?
Now ask about banking terms.
Great! Much clearer now. Let's handle any issues!
Good try! Ask about banking terms. Try again!
Let's try again. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
Something went wrong? Here's how to report issues:
I noticed an unauthorized charge
I need to dispute a transaction
My card isn't working
I think someone accessed my account
Now report a banking issue.
Well handled! Let's say goodbye to the teller!
Good try! Report the issue. Try again!
Let's try again. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
All done! Here's how to leave the bank politely:
Thank you for your help today!
You've been very helpful, thanks!
Thanks! Have a great day!
I appreciate your patience. Goodbye!
Now say goodbye to the bank teller.
Wonderful! You completed the entire bank experience!
Good try! Say goodbye. Try again!
Let's try again. Use the phrase from the reference card above.

Congratulations! You've completed the bank lesson! You now know how to: make deposits and withdrawals, ask about your account, handle card issues, and use the ATM. You're ready to handle banking with confidence!
Welcome to today's lesson! We'll learn how to communicate at the doctor's office. When you're ready, click the button below to start!
You arrive at the doctor's office. Here's how to check in:
Hi, I have an appointment at 10 AM
I'm here to see Dr. Smith
I'd like to make an appointment
Is the doctor running on time?
Great! Now check in at the reception using that phrase.
Great! The receptionist is checking you in. Let's describe your symptoms!
Good try! Tell the receptionist why you're here. Try again!
Let's check in at the clinic. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The doctor asks what's wrong. Here's how to describe your symptoms:
I have a headache
I've had a fever for two days
My throat hurts
I feel dizzy
Perfect! Now describe your symptom using that phrase.
Well done! The doctor understands. Let's answer some questions!
Good try! Describe your symptoms clearly. Try again!
Let's describe your symptoms. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The doctor asks about your pain. Here's how to describe it:
It's a sharp pain
It hurts when I breathe
The pain comes and goes
On a scale of 1-10, it's about a 7
Great! Now describe your pain using that phrase.
Excellent! That helps the doctor. Let's talk about your medical history!
Good try! Answer the doctor's questions. Try again!
Let's answer the doctor. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The doctor asks how long you've had these symptoms and how often they occur.
It started about a week ago.
I've had this for a few months now.
It comes and goes every few days.
This just started yesterday.
Great choice! Now tell the doctor how long you've had this symptom!
Good, the doctor is noting the timeline. Now let's discuss your medical history.
Nice try! Describe the duration more clearly. Try again!
Let's tell the doctor the duration. Try the phrase from the card above.
The doctor asks about your medical history. Here's how to answer:
I'm allergic to penicillin
I take medication for blood pressure
I had surgery last year
My family has a history of diabetes
Perfect! Now share your medical history using that phrase.
Perfect! The doctor has all the information. Let's listen to the diagnosis!
Good try! Share your medical history. Try again!
Let's share your history. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The doctor explains the diagnosis. Here's how to ask for clarification:
What does that mean?
Is it serious?
What caused this?
Could you explain that again?
Great! Now ask for clarification using that phrase.
Great! You understand the diagnosis. Let's ask about treatment!
Good try! Ask about the diagnosis. Try again!
Let's ask about the diagnosis. Use the phrase from the reference card above.
The doctor discusses treatment. Here's how to ask about it:
What treatment do you recommend?
Are there any side effects?
How long will the treatment take?
Do I need to take any medication?
Perfect! Now ask about treatment using that phrase.
Well done! Treatment plan clear. Let's ask about medication!
